Key Match Events: Netherlands batted fiercely with opener Stephan Myburgh slamming 37 off 30 balls.
Tom Cooper gave the innings the needed impetus as he accounted for a quick-fire 35, but it was Colin Ackermann who changed the complexion of the match with 41 off 26.
South Africa kept on losing timely wickets and at one stage were 39/2.
Chasing 159, South Africa eventually lost the match by 13 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa are going home and this would be demoralising; they were one of the favourites.
This game was lost when David Miller and Heinrich Klaasen were dismissed.
South Africa choked true to their nature, meanwhile what a match for Netherlands. They have shown amazing fight to beat South Africa by 13 runs. They also now qualify for the 2024 T20 World Cup.
Netherlands are now qualifying for the 2024 T20 World Cup.
Pakistan and Bangladesh both are in contention for the final spot in the last four.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Netherlands sent South Africa crashing out of the Twenty20 World Cup on Sunday with a stunning 13-run victory in Adelaide which also propelled India into the semi-finals.
Bangladesh and Pakistan are fighting it out for the final spot in the last four.
The latest in a series of shocks at this tournament left Bangladesh and Pakistan fighting it out for the final spot in the last four.
A win will be enough for South Africa to become the first team from Group 2 and third overall to progress to the semifinals of the ICC Menâ€™s T20 World Cup 2022.
Others: The match took place on November 6, 2022, at the Adelaide Oval.
The match began at 5:30 am IST.
The match was streamed live on Disney+ Hotstar and televised on Star Sports Network in India.
